get.summary: Fundamental data for a debt instrument.
get.description: Fundamental data for a debt instrument; any other instrument yields empty values for debt-instrument-specific attributes. Dates are interpreted in the timezone of the issuer.

parameters.name: _attributes
parameters.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.

data.description: Fundamental data for a debt instrument.

isin.description: The International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) of the instrument. The ISIN is a 12-character code of digits and upper-case letters that uniquely identifies an instrument.

wkn.description: The WKN (Wertpapierkennnummer, German for Securities Identification Number) of the instrument. The WKN is a 6-character code of digits and upper-case letters that uniquely identifies an instrument.

valor.description: The Valor number (German: Valorennummer) of the instrument. The Valor number is an integer number that uniquely identifies an instrument.

type.description: Instrument type as defined by FactSet Digital Solutions. Instrument types are arranged in a hierarchy, with the first level representing the most coarse granularity and further levels successively refining the granularity (see MDG category system 18). See endpoint `/category/get` for possible values.

date.description: Date of the instrument's maturity. The value is empty if the instrument is perpetual.

isPerpetual.description: If true, the instrument is perpetual, i.e. it does not mature, therefore the attribute `date` is null.

isCallable.description: If true, the issuer may redeem the instrument prior to maturity.

issuer.description: Issuer of the instrument. See endpoint `/legalEntity/list` for possible values.

lei.description: Legal Entity Identifier of the issuer.

valueUnit.description: Value unit of the issue price such as percentages for a debt instrument quoted in percent, or a main or a fractional currency for a per-unit-quoted debt instrument (rarely). See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for possible values.

currency.description: Main currency of denomination of the issue volume. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

code.description: Code of the currency: if assigned, a code according to ISO 4217, otherwise a local code.

tradingVolume.description: Requirements regarding the trading volume in the over-the-counter (non-exchange-based) trading. For the currency of the trading volume, see attribute `issue.volume.currency`.

minimum.description: Minimum trading volume.

increment.description: Incremental trading volume over the minimum. The trading volume over the minimum must be an integral multiple of the increment.

valueUnit.description: Value unit of the redemption price such as percentages for a debt instrument quoted in percent, or a main or a fractional currency for a per-unit-quoted debt instrument (rarely). See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for possible values.

currency.description: Main currency of the redemption. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

code.description: Code of the currency: if assigned, a code according to ISO 4217, otherwise a local code.

nominalValue.description: Nominal value for per-unit quoted debt instruments. Debt instruments quoted in percent do not have a nominal value per se.

debtRanking.description: Ranking data of the debt instrument. It indicates how payments related to the debt instrument are ranked  compared to payments on the issuer's other obligations.

isTrusteeEligible.description: If true, the debt instrument is eligible for investments by trustees according to §§1806ff of the BGB (German Civil Code). The German legislative has declared it to be virtually free of the risk of loss, such as government and state bonds. Eligible are primarily German securities.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

post.summary: Search for issuers of debt instruments.
post.description: Search for issuers of debt instruments. FactSet does not consolidate the data provided by different suppliers, therefore the result may contain more than one identifier for a given issuer. The response is limited to 100 results.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

searchValue.description: Text string to be searched for.

minimumRatingGrade.description: Minimum rating grade requirements for the issuers or their debt instruments. In either case, only one identifier per rating system is allowed. See endpoint `/rating/grade/listBySystem` for valid values.

debtInstrument.description: Debt instrument rating. Only issuers whose debt instruments are rated higher than or equal to the rating grades in the provided list are returned.

country.description: List of countries of registration of the issuers. Only issuers that are registered in a country in the provided list are returned.

ids.description: List of country identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/region/country/list` for valid values.

market.description: List of markets where debt instruments are traded. Only issuers that have issued at least one debt instrument traded on a market in the provided list are returned.

ids.description: List of market identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/market/list` for valid values.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: List of issuers, sorted descending by the number of debt instruments issued.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

get.summary: Key figures of a debt instrument.
get.description: Key figures of a debt instrument. The key figures are calculated using delayed prices with an additional delay of 10 minutes after an  update of the debt instrument's price. Special product features such as the right to a maturity extension, an attached option, or convertibility are not considered for the key figure calculation. Further, a calculation is not performed for perpetual products and for products with variable interest rate.

parameters.name: _attributes
parameters.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.

time.description: Date and time of the calculation.

valueUnit.description: Value unit of the notation of the debt instrument, such as a main currency for a per-unit-quoted debt instrument (rarely), or percentages for a debt instrument quoted in percent. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for possible values.

dirtyPricing.description: If true, the attribute `price.value` contains the accrued interest.

current.description: Current yield, which is the next annual interest payment divided by the price. If the coupon period is different than a year, the interest payment is annualized.

toMaturity.description: Yield to maturity, which is the annual rate of return, assuming the instrument is held until maturity.

spread.description: Credit spread, which is the difference in yield to maturity between a highest-quality debt instrument, also called a benchmark bond, and the debt instrument. See endpoint `/instrument/benchmark/list` for the benchmark bond.

macaulayDuration.description: Macaulay duration, which is the average period (in years) of capital commitment.

sensitivities.description: Price sensitivities of the debt instrument with respect to the prevailing market interest rate.

basePointValue.description: Base point value, which is the change of the debt instrument's price for a one base point change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate. One base point is equivalent to 0,01 percent (1/100 of a percent). See attribute `price/valueUnit` for its value unit.

modifiedDuration.description: Modified duration, which is the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate.

elasticity.description: Yield elasticity, which is the ratio of the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (relatively, not nominally) of the prevailing market interest rate.

convexity.description: Convexity, which is a measure for the change of the modified duration as the prevailing market interest rate changes.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

post.summary: Screener for debt instruments' notations based on debt instrument-specific parameters.
post.description: Screener for debt instruments' notations based on debt instrument-specific parameters. The result is limited to the notations that satisfy all the selected filters. If more than one notation of an instrument matches the parameters, and no market priority has been specified, only the notation with the highest trading volume, averaged over one month, is considered.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

onlyActive.description: If `true`, only active notations will be returned. The term "active" reflects the fact that notations and related data is not being deleted immediately after becoming irrelevant (e.g. because the source does not provide a price anymore), but remains in general retrievable for up to 6 months.

onlyNotSuspended.description: If `true`, only notations not suspended from trading will be returned.

x-enum-description: Delayed: intraday prices with an exchange-imposed delay of usually 15 to 30 minutes.
End-of-day: prices updated once per day after the close of trading, possibly with an exchange-imposed delay of several hours or days.

latest.description: Parameters related to the presence and age of the most recent trade price.

availableOnly.description: If `true`, only notations for which a trade price (even an outdated one) is available will be returned.

minimumDate.description: Earliest admissible date of the most recent trade price.

previous.description: Parameters related to the presence and age of a trade price from a preceding trading day.

availableOnly.description: If `true`, only notations for which a trade price from a preceding trading day is available will be returned.

minimumDate.description: Earliest admissible date of the trade price from a preceding trading day.

valueUnit.description: Value unit selection. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Specifies the value units a notation may have.

exclude.description: Specifies the value units a notation may not have.

market.description: Market-related notation selection. See endpoint `/basic/market/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Specifies the markets from which a notation may originate.

exclude.description: Specifies the markets from which a notation may not originate.

priority.description:
Sequence of markets specifying the priority order of the markets for the selection of one notation per instrument. If for a given instrument with two matching notations, A and B, the market of notation A precedes the market of notation B in this list or if the market of notation B is not in this list, A is selected. If neither of the markets is in this list, the notation with the highest trading volume, averaged over one month, is selected.        
 The list does not restrict the request to only those markets (use the parameter `market.selection` for that purpose).

restrict.description: Restriction lists. If present, the result contains only notations belonging to debt instruments that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of restriction lists.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. If present, the result does not contain notations belonging to debt instruments that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of exclusion lists.

restrict.description: Restriction lists. If present, the result contains only debt instrument notations that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of restriction lists.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. If present, the result does not contain debt instrument notations that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of exclusion lists.

categorization.description: Debt instrument categorization. See endpoint `/category/listBySystem` with `id=18` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments that belong to a category in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. Debt instruments that belong to a category in the provided list are not returned.

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the past.

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the future.

issue.description: Date range of the issue date.

restriction.description: The maturity can be restricted by using one of the parameters `date` or `remainingTermYears` but not both at the same time. If a maturity restriction is set, perpetual instruments, i.e. such that do not mature, are not included in the result unless the parameter `perpetual` is set to "include".

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the past.

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the future.

date.description: Date range of the maturity date.

remainingTermYears.description: Value range for the remaining term to maturity expressed in years.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

perpetual.description: Defines whether or not perpetual debt instruments, i.e. such that do not mature, are included in the result. The value "only" can be used if both parameters `maturity.restriction.date` and `maturity.restriction.remainingTermYears` are not set.
x-enum-description: Only perpetual debt instruments are included in the result.
Perpetual debt instruments are included in the result even if one of the parameters `maturity.restriction.date` or `maturity.restriction.remainingTermYears` is set.
Perpetual debt instruments are excluded from the result.

callable.description: Restricts the result to debt instruments that are callable (`true`) or are not callable (`false`). A callable instrument is one that may be redeemed by the issuer prior to maturity.

subordinated.description: Restricts the result to debt instruments that are subordinated (`true`) or are not subordinated (`false`). In case of default, subordinated debt instruments are redeemed with a lower priority than non-subordinated.

rating.description: Parameters related to a rating of a debt instrument.

minimum.description: Minimum rating grade.

ids.description: List of rating grade identifiers. Allowed are at most two identifiers which must refer to rating grades originating from different rating systems. Only debt instruments that satisfy all conditions, i.e. are rated higher than or equal to all provided rating grades, are returned. The sequence of the provided identifiers corresponds to the response attributes `ratingSystem1` and `ratingSystem2` respectively, i.e. the rating grade of a debt instrument in the rating system of which the first identifier in the provided list is a member, is represented by the attribute `ratingSystem1.rating.grade` (and `ratingSystem1.rating.id` for the identifier of the rating grade).

selection.description: Issuer selection. See endpoint `/debtInstrument/issuer/search` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments issued by an issuer in the provided list are returned.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of legal entities in the role of an issuer.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments issued by an issuer in the provided list are not returned.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of legal entities in the role of an issuer.

country.description: Selection of the country of registration of the debt instrtuments' issuer. See endpoint `/basic/region/country/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments issued by an issuer whose country of registration is in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments issued by an issuer whose country of registration is in the provided list are not returned.

currency.description: Selection of the main currency of denomination of the issue volume. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments with a main currency of denomination in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments with a main currency of denomination in the provided list are not returned.

tradingVolume.description: Parameters regarding the trading volume. The issuer of a debt instrument may define a minimum trading volume, and an increment over that minimum, per market place and for the over-the-counter (e.g. interbank) trade. Orders that do not match the defined volumes cannot be (fully) executed. The currency is the currency of denomination, thus the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one currency in order to use this parameter.

otc.description: Volume applicable to the over-the-counter (non-exchange based) trading.

minimum.description: Value range for the minimum trading volume.
The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

germany.description: Compliance properties in accordance with the German law.

trusteeEligible.description: Defines whether or not the debt instruments are eligible for investment by trustees according to §§1806ff of the BGB (German Civil Code). The German legislative has declared such debt instruments to be virtually free of the risk of loss, such as government and state bonds. Eligible are primarily German debt instruments.

occurrence.description: Parameters regarding the occurrence and frequency of the coupon payments.

x-enum-description: Include debt instruments that do not pay a coupon.
Include debt instruments that pay a coupon only once.
Include debt instruments that pay a coupon on a repeated basis, possibly further limited by `occurrence.frequency`.

type.description: Occurrence type of the coupon payments.

frequency.description: Frequency of the coupon payments. This filter is only applied to debt instruments whose `coupon.occurrence.type` is `repeated`. If this parameter is set, `occurrence.type` must include the value `repeated` or must not be set (in which case `repeated` is implied).

ids.description: List of frequency identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/frequency/type/list` for valid values.

currentInterestRate.description: Interest rate of the current coupon period. Not available for debt instruments with an occurrence type of the coupon payments "never".

ids.description: List of interest rate type identifiers. See endpoint `/instrument/coupon/interestRate/type/list` for valid values.

value.description: Value range for the interest rate of the current coupon period; annualized if the payment frequency is not "annually". Not available for debt instruments with a current interest rate type other than "fixed rate" (`id=2`) or "step/reset" (`id=5`).

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

current.description: Value range for the current yield, which is the next annual interest payment divided by the price. If the coupon period is different than a year, the interest payment is annualized.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

toMaturity.description: Value range for the yield to maturity, which is the annual rate of return, assuming the instrument is held until maturity.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

spread.description: Value range for the credit spread (the difference in yield to maturity) between a debt instrument and its benchmark bond. See endpoint `/instrument/benchmark/list` for the benchmark bond.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

macaulayDuration.description: Value range for the Macaulay duration, which is the average period (in years) of capital commitment.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

sensitivities.description: Parameters related to the price sensitivities of debt instruments with respect to the prevailing market interest rate.

basePointValue.description: Value range for the base point value, which is the change of the debt instrument's price for a one base point change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate. One base point is equivalent to 0.01 percent (1/100 of a percent). The unit of the base point value is the value unit of the notation, thus the parameter `validation.valueUnit.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one value unit in order to use the parameter.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

modifiedDuration.description: Value range for the modified duration, which is the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

elasticity.description: Value range for the yield elasticity, which is the ratio of the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (relatively, not nominally) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

convexity.description: Value range for the convexity, which is a measure for the change of the modified duration as the prevailing market interest rate changes.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

tradedValue.description: Parameters regarding the cash flow for all transactions over a certain time range. The currency is the currency of denomination, thus the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one currency in order to use these parameters.

days30.description: Cash flow for the time range 30 trading days.

sum.description: Value range for the sum of the cash flow.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

average.description: Value range for the average daily cash flow.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

sort.description: Sortable attributes. The sort order is ascending unless it is prefixed with a minus sign, in which case it is descending. A list of at most 10 (possibly prefixed) attribute name(s) is allowed.

pagination.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy.

offset.description: Non-negative number of entries to skip, or 0 (default).

limit.description: Non-negative maximum number of entries to return.

valueUnit.description: Value unit of the notation such as a main or fractional currency for equities, a percentage for debt instruments, or points for indices. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for possible values.

code.description: Code of the value unit: If assigned, a code according to ISO 4217, otherwise a local code, for a main currency; a code such as GBp (for British pence) for a fractional currency; or a code such as PT (points) for non-currency value units.

symbol.description: The symbol of the notation. It is a market-specific code to identify the notation. Which characters can be part of a symbol depends on the market. If a market does not define a proprietary symbol, but uses a different identifier (for example, the ISIN or the WKN) to identify instruments, no symbol will be set for the notations of that market.

sedol.description: The SEDOL or IDII for the notation.

fsym.description: Notation-level FactSet identifiers of the financial instrument used primarily in FactSet products other than the MDG.

permanentIdentifier.description: FactSet Permanent Identifier for a notation. The format is six alpha numeric characters, excluding vowels, with an L suffix (XXXXXX-L).

tickerExchange.description: FactSet market symbol of the notation, usually consisting of the ticker (e.g. "DAI" for Daimler AG) and the three-character code of the exchange on which the listing is traded (example: DAI-ETR).

isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the notation is the primary notation among all notations within the same region (`true`) or not (`false`).

permanentIdentifier.description: FactSet Permanent Identifier for a set of one or more notations of the same region with the same value unit. The format is six alpha numeric characters, excluding vowels, with an R suffix (XXXXXX-R).

tickerRegion.description: FactSet regional symbol of the notation, consisting of the ticker and the two-character code of the country or region where the listing is traded (example: DAI-DE).

isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the notation is in the primary region of the security (`true`) or not (`false`).

isin.description: The International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) of the instrument. The ISIN is a 12-character code of digits and upper-case letters that uniquely identifies an instrument.

wkn.description: The WKN (Wertpapierkennnummer, German for Securities Identification Number) of the instrument. The WKN is a 6-character code of digits and upper-case letters that uniquely identifies an instrument.

valor.description: The Valor number (German: Valorennummer) of the instrument. The Valor number is an integer number that uniquely identifies an instrument.

cusip.description: The CUSIP (Committee on Uniform Security Identification Procedures) or CINS (CUSIP International Numbering System) identifier of the instrument. These numbers are 9-character codes of digits and upper-case letters that uniquely identify an instrument.

fsym.description: Instrument-level FactSet identifier of the financial instrument used primarily in FactSet products other than the MDG.

permanentIdentifier.description: FactSet Permanent Identifier for an instrument. The format is six alpha numeric characters, excluding vowels, with an S suffix (XXXXXX-S).

categorization.description: Debt instrument categorization. See endpoint `/category/listBySystem` with `id=18` for valid values.

level1.description: First, most coarse, level of categorization.

level3.description: Third, most detailed, level of categorization.

lifeCycle.description: Important dates of the debt instrument.

date.description: Date of the debt instrument's maturity. The value is empty if the instrument is perpetual.

remainingTermYears.description: Remaining term to maturity expressed in years.

perpetual.description: If `true`, the debt instrument is perpetual, i.e. it does not mature, therefore the attribute `date` is `null`.

callable.description: If `true`, the issuer may redeem the instrument prior to maturity.

subordinated.description: If `true`, the debt instrument is subordinated.

ratingSystem1.description: Rating of the debt instrument according to the rating system of the first identifier in the list provided in the parameter `rating.grade.minimum.ids`.

rating.description: Rating of the debt instrument. See endpoint `/rating/grade/listBySystem` with the identifier of the respective rating system for possible values. See endpoint `/rating/grade/get` with the identifier of the rating grade for the identifier of the rating system.

ratingSystem2.description: Rating of the debt instrument according to the rating system of the second identifier in the list provided in the parameter `rating.grade.minimum.ids`.

rating.description: Rating of the debt instrument. See endpoint `/rating/grade/listBySystem` with the identifier of the respective rating system for possible values. See endpoint `/rating/grade/get` with the identifier of the rating grade for the identifier of the rating system.

issuer.description: Issuer of the debt instrument. See endpoint `/legalEntity/list` for possible values.

country.description: Country of registration of the issuer. See endpoint `/basic/region/country/list` for possible values.

issue.description: Issue data of the debt instrument.

currency.description: Main currency of denomination of the issue volume. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

tradingVolume.description: Requirements regarding the trading volume. The currency is the currency of denomination (see attribute `issue.volume.currency`), thus the values are not comparable if debt instruments with different currencies of denomination are among the results.

otc.description: Volume applicable to the over-the-counter (non-exchange based) trading.

minimum.description: Minimum trading volume.

germany.description: Compliance properties in accordance with the German law.

trusteeEligible.description: If `true`, the debt instrument is eligible for investments by trustees according to §§1806ff of the BGB (German Civil Code). The German legislative has declared it to be virtually free of the risk of loss, such as government and state bonds. Eligible are primarily German debt instruments.

occurrence.description: Occurrence and frequency of the coupon payments.

type.description: Occurrence type of the coupon payments.
x-enum-description: The debt instrument does not pay out a coupon.
The debt instrument pays out a coupon only once.
The debt instrument pays out a coupon on a repeated basis.

frequency.description: Frequency of the coupon payments. Information about the frequency is available only if the attribute `occurrence.type` is set to `repeated`. See endpoint `/basic/frequency/type/list` for possible values of the frequency.

currentInterestRate.description: Details of the current coupon period.

type.description: Type of the interest rate, see endpoint `/instrument/coupon/interestRate/type/list` for possible values.

value.description: Value of the interest rate; annualized if the payment frequency is not "annually". See endpoint `/instrument/coupon/keyData/get` for details regarding the current period.

current.description: Current yield, which is the next annual interest payment divided by the price. If the coupon period is different than a year, the interest payment is annualized.

toMaturity.description: Yield to maturity, which is the annual rate of return, assuming the instrument is held until maturity.

spread.description: Credit spread, which is the difference in yield to maturity between a highest-quality debt instrument, also called a benchmark bond, and the debt instrument. See endpoint `/instrument/benchmark/list` for the benchmark bond.

macaulayDuration.description: Macaulay duration, which is the average period (in years) of capital commitment.

sensitivities.description: Price sensitivities of the debt instrument with respect to the prevailing market interest rate.

basePointValue.description: Base point value, which is the change of the debt instrument's price for a one base point change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate. One base point is equivalent to 0.01 percent (1/100 of a percent). The unit of the base point value is the value unit of the notation (see attribute `valueUnit`), thus the values are not comparable if notations with different value units are among the results.

modifiedDuration.description: Modified duration, which is the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate.

elasticity.description: Yield elasticity, which is the ratio of the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (relatively, not nominally) of the prevailing market interest rate.

convexity.description: Convexity, which is a measure for the change of the modified duration as the prevailing market interest rate changes.

tradedValue.description: Cash flow for all transactions over a certain time range. The currency is the currency of denomination (see attribute `issue.volume.currency`), thus the values are not comparable if debt instruments with different currencies of denomination are among the results.

days30.description: Cash flow for the time range 30 trading days.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

post.summary: Possible values and value ranges for the parameters used in the endpoint `/debtInstrument/notation/screener/search.`
post.description: The endpoint returns the possible values and value ranges for the parameters used in the endpoint `/debtInstrument/notation/screener/search`. It allows to request the values and value ranges only for a restricted set of notations that match predefined parameters. The functionality may be used to pre-fill the values and value ranges of the parameters of the `/debtInstrument/notation/screener/search` endpoint so that performing a search always leads to a non-empty set of notations. If more than one notation of an instrument matches the parameters, and no market priority has been specified, only the notation with the highest trading volume, averaged over one month, is considered.

data.description: The data member contains the request's primary data.

onlyActive.description: If `true`, only active notations will be returned. The term "active" reflects the fact that notations and related data is not being deleted immediately after becoming irrelevant (e.g. because the source does not provide a price anymore), but remains in general retrievable for up to 6 months.

onlyNotSuspended.description: If `true`, only notations not suspended from trading will be returned.

x-enum-description: Delayed: intraday prices with an exchange-imposed delay of usually 15 to 30 minutes.
End-of-day: prices updated once per day after the close of trading, possibly with an exchange-imposed delay of several hours or days.

latest.description: Parameters related to the presence and age of the most recent trade price.

availableOnly.description: If `true`, only notations for which a trade price (even an outdated one) is available will be returned.

minimumDate.description: Earliest admissible date of the most recent trade price.

previous.description: Parameters related to the presence and age of a trade price from a preceding trading day.

availableOnly.description: If `true`, only notations for which a trade price from a preceding trading day is available will be returned.

minimumDate.description: Earliest admissible date of the trade price from a preceding trading day.

valueUnit.description: Value unit selection. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Specifies the value units a notation may have.

exclude.description: Specifies the value units a notation may not have.

market.description: Market-related notation selection. See endpoint `/basic/market/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Specifies the markets from which a notation may originate.

exclude.description: Specifies the markets from which a notation may not originate.

priority.description:
Sequence of markets specifying the priority order of the markets for the selection of one notation per instrument. If for a given instrument with two matching notations, A and B, the market of notation A precedes the market of notation B in this list or if the market of notation B is not in this list, A is selected. If neither of the markets is in this list, the notation with the highest trading volume, averaged over one month, is selected.        
 The list does not restrict the request to only those markets (use the parameter `market.selection` for that purpose).

restrict.description: Restriction lists. If present, the result contains only notations belonging to debt instruments that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of restriction lists.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. If present, the result does not contain notations belonging to debt instruments that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of exclusion lists.

restrict.description: Restriction lists. If present, the result contains only debt instrument notations that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of restriction lists.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. If present, the result does not contain debt instrument notations that are a member of any of the provided lists.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of exclusion lists.

categorization.description: Debt instrument categorization. See endpoint `/category/listBySystem` with `id=18` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments that belong to a category in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion lists. Debt instruments that belong to a category in the provided list are not returned.

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the past.

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the future.

issue.description: Date range of the issue date.

restriction.description: The maturity can be restricted by using one of the parameters `date` or `remainingTermYears` but not both at the same time. If a maturity restriction is set, perpetual instruments, i.e. such that do not mature, are not included in the result unless the parameter `perpetual` is set to "include".

start.description: The starting point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the past.

end.description: The ending point of the date range (inclusive), or `null` to indicate that the date range extends indefinitely into the future.

date.description: Date range of the maturity date.

remainingTermYears.description: Value range for the remaining term to maturity expressed in years.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

perpetual.description: Defines whether or not perpetual debt instruments, i.e. such that do not mature, are included in the result. The value "only" can be used if both parameters `maturity.restriction.date` and `maturity.restriction.remainingTermYears` are not set.
x-enum-description: Only perpetual debt instruments are included in the result.
Perpetual debt instruments are included in the result even if one of the parameters `maturity.restriction.date` or `maturity.restriction.remainingTermYears` is set.
Perpetual debt instruments are excluded from the result.

callable.description: Restricts the result to debt instruments that are callable (`true`) or are not callable (`false`). A callable instrument is one that may be redeemed by the issuer prior to maturity.

subordinated.description: Restricts the result to debt instruments that are subordinated (`true`) or are not subordinated (`false`). In case of default, subordinated debt instruments are redeemed with a lower priority than non-subordinated.

rating.description: Parameters related to a rating of a debt instrument. If a rating system is not selected by either specifying it directly (see parameter `rating.system.ids`) or by implying it via the minimum rating grade (see parameter `rating.grade.minimum.ids`) the result contains no data on ratings.

system.description: Rating system. The parameter allows to specify the rating system (up to two) from which the available ratings of the restricted set of debt instruments are retrieved without limiting the debt instrument selection to only debt instruments with a rating in that rating system.

ids.description: List of identifiers of rating systems. The sequence of the provided identifiers corresponds to the response attributes `ratingSystem1` and `ratingSystem2` respectively, i.e. the rating grades of the selected debt instruments in the rating system of which the first identifier in the provided list is a member, is represented by the attribute `ratingSystem1.rating.grade` (and `ratingSystem1.rating.id` for the identifier of the rating grade).

minimum.description: Minimum rating grade.

ids.description: List of rating grade identifiers. Allowed are at most two identifiers which must refer to rating grades originating from different rating systems. Only debt instruments that satisfy all conditions, i.e. are rated higher than or equal to all provided rating grades, are returned. The sequence of the provided identifiers corresponds to the response attributes `ratingSystem1` and `ratingSystem2` respectively, i.e. the rating grade of a debt instrument in the rating system of which the first identifier in the provided list is a member, is represented by the attribute `ratingSystem1.rating.grade` (and `ratingSystem1.rating.id` for the identifier of the rating grade).

selection.description: Issuer selection. See endpoint `/debtInstrument/issuer/search` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments issued by an issuer in the provided list are returned.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of legal entities in the role of an issuer.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments issued by an issuer in the provided list are not returned.

ids.description: Set of identifiers of legal entities in the role of an issuer.

country.description: Selection of the country of registration of the debt instrtuments' issuer. See endpoint `/basic/region/country/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments issued by an issuer whose country of registration is in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments issued by an issuer whose country of registration is in the provided list are not returned.

currency.description: Selection of the main currency of denomination of the issue volume. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for valid values.

restrict.description: Restriction list. Only debt instruments with a main currency of denomination in the provided list are returned.

exclude.description: Exclusion list. Debt instruments with a main currency of denomination in the provided list are not returned.

tradingVolume.description: Parameters regarding the trading volume. The issuer of a debt instrument may define a minimum trading volume, and an increment over that minimum, per market place and for the over-the-counter (e.g. interbank) trade. Orders that do not match the defined volumes cannot be (fully) executed. The currency is the currency of denomination, thus the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one currency in order to use this parameter.

otc.description: Volume applicable to the over-the-counter (non-exchange based) trading.

minimum.description: Value range for the minimum trading volume.
The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

germany.description: Compliance properties in accordance with the German law.

trusteeEligible.description: Defines whether or not the debt instruments are eligible for investment by trustees according to §§1806ff of the BGB (German Civil Code). The German legislative has declared such debt instruments to be virtually free of the risk of loss, such as government and state bonds. Eligible are primarily German debt instruments.

occurrence.description: Parameters regarding the occurrence and frequency of the coupon payments.

x-enum-description: Include debt instruments that do not pay a coupon.
Include debt instruments that pay a coupon only once.
Include debt instruments that pay a coupon on a repeated basis, possibly further limited by `occurrence.frequency`.

type.description: Occurrence type of the coupon payments.

frequency.description: Frequency of the coupon payments. This filter is only applied to debt instruments whose `coupon.occurrence.type` is `repeated`. If this parameter is set, `occurrence.type` must include the value `repeated` or must not be set (in which case `repeated` is implied).

ids.description: List of frequency identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/frequency/type/list` for valid values.

currentInterestRate.description: Interest rate of the current coupon period. Not available for debt instruments with an occurrence type of the coupon payments "never".

ids.description: List of interest rate type identifiers. See endpoint `/instrument/coupon/interestRate/type/list` for valid values.

value.description: Value range for the interest rate of the current coupon period; annualized if the payment frequency is not "annually". Not available for debt instruments with a current interest rate type other than "fixed rate" (`id=2`) or "step/reset" (`id=5`).

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

current.description: Value range for the current yield, which is the next annual interest payment divided by the price. If the coupon period is different than a year, the interest payment is annualized.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

toMaturity.description: Value range for the yield to maturity, which is the annual rate of return, assuming the instrument is held until maturity.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

spread.description: Value range for the credit spread (the difference in yield to maturity) between a debt instrument and its benchmark bond. See endpoint `/instrument/benchmark/list` for the benchmark bond.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

macaulayDuration.description: Value range for the Macaulay duration, which is the average period (in years) of capital commitment.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

sensitivities.description: Parameters related to the price sensitivities of debt instruments with respect to the prevailing market interest rate.

basePointValue.description: Value range for the base point value, which is the change of the debt instrument's price for a one base point change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate. One base point is equivalent to 0.01 percent (1/100 of a percent). The unit of the base point value is the value unit of the notation, thus the parameter `validation.valueUnit.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one value unit in order to use the parameter.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

modifiedDuration.description: Value range for the modified duration, which is the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

elasticity.description: Value range for the yield elasticity, which is the ratio of the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (relatively, not nominally) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

convexity.description: Value range for the convexity, which is a measure for the change of the modified duration as the prevailing market interest rate changes.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

tradedValue.description: Parameters regarding the cash flow for all transactions over a certain time range. The currency is the currency of denomination, thus the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` must be set to exactly one currency in order to use these parameters.

days30.description: Cash flow for the time range 30 trading days.

sum.description: Value range for the sum of the cash flow.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

average.description: Value range for the average daily cash flow.

minimum.description: The minimum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no minimum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the minimum value is included in the range or not.

maximum.description: The maximum of the range, or `null` to indicate that there is no maximum.

inclusive.description: Indicates whether the maximum value is included in the range or not.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the request.

data.description: Possible values and value ranges of the parameters.

totalCount.description: Number of notations that satisfy the request parameters, hence have been used to retrieve the possible values and value ranges.

valueUnit.description: List of value unit identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/list` for possible values.

code.description: Code of the value unit: If assigned, a code according to ISO 4217, otherwise a local code, for a main currency; a code such as GBp (for British pence) for a fractional currency; or a code such as PT (points) for non-currency value units.

market.description: List of market identifiers. See endpoint `/basic/market/list` for possible values.

categorization.description: Lists of categories of the debt instruments' categorization. Starting with the most coarse level (one), for each level of the category system, the list of categories of the debt instruments, matching the parameters, is returned. See endpoint `/category/listBySystem` with `id=18` for possible values.

number.description: Number of the category level, indicating the distance to the root of the category hierarchy.

categories.description: List of categories for the given level of the debt instruments' categorization.

parent.description: Parent category or `null` if this category is on the first level.

lifeCycle.description: Values and value ranges related to important dates.

issue.description: Date range of the issue date.

minimum.description: Minimum date.

maximum.description: Maximum date.

date.description: Date range of the maturity date.

minimum.description: Minimum date.

maximum.description: Maximum date.

remainingTermYears.description: Value range for the remaining term to maturity expressed in years.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

perpetual.description: Indicates whether perpetual and non-perpetual debt instruments are among the results. A perpetual debt instrument is one that does not mature.

callable.description: Indicates whether callable and non-callable debt instruments are among the results. A callable debt instrument is one that may be redeemed by the issuer prior to maturity.

subordinated.description: Indicates whether subordinated and non-subordinated are among the results. In case of default, subordinated debt instruments are redeemed with a lower priority than non-subordinated.

ratingSystem1.description: Ratings of the debt instruments according to the rating system specified by either the first identifier provided in the parameter `rating.system.ids`, or of the rating system implied by the first identifier provided in the parameter `rating.minimum.grade.ids`. Not available, if a rating system has not been specified via the mentioned parameters.

ratingSystem2.description: Ratings of the debt instruments according to the rating system specified by either the second identifier provided in the parameter `rating.system.ids`, or of the rating system implied by the second identifier provided in the parameter `rating.minimum.grade.ids`. Not available, if a rating system has not been specified via the mentioned parameters.

issuer.description: Values and value ranges related to the issuer of the debt instruments.

juristicPerson.description: List of juristic persons in the role of an issuer. See endpoint `/debtInstrument/issuer/search` for possible values.

country.description: List of countries where the issuers of the debt instruments are registered. See endpoint `/basic/region/country/list` for possible values.

issue.description: Values and value ranges related to the issue of the debt instruments.

volume.description: Values and value ranges related to the issue volumes of the debt instruments.

currency.description: List of main currencies of denomination of the the issue volumes. See endpoint `/basic/valueUnit/currency/main/list` for possible values.

tradingVolume.description: Value ranges regarding requirements related to the trading volume. The currency is the currency of denomination (see attribute `issue.volume.currency`). Not available, if the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` has not been set to a single currency.

otc.description: Value ranges of the volume applicable to the over-the-counter (non-exchange based) trading.

minimum.description: Minimum trading volume.
Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

germany.description: Compliance properties in accordance with the German law.

trusteeEligible.description: Indicates whether debt instruments eligible for investments by trustees according to §§1806ff of the BGB (German Civil Code) are among the results. The German legislative has declared it to be virtually free of the risk of loss, such as government and state bonds. Eligible are primarily German debt instruments.

coupon.description: Values and value ranges related to the interest rate.

occurrence.description: Occurrence and frequency of the coupon payments.

type.description: Occurrence types of the coupon payments.

x-enum-description: The debt instrument does not pay out a coupon.
The debt instrument pays out a coupon only once.
The debt instrument pays out a coupon on a repeated basis.

frequency.description: Frequency of the coupon payments; applicable only to debt instruments with an occurrence type `repeated`. See endpoint `/basic/frequency/type/list` for possible values.

currentInterestRate.description: Values and value ranges applicable to the current coupon period.

type.description: Interest rate types. See endpoint `/instrument/coupon/interestRate/type/list` for possible values.

value.description: Value range of the interest rate; annualized if the payment frequency is not annually.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

yield.description: Value ranges of the yield-related key figures.

current.description: Current yield, which is the next annual interest payment divided by the price. If the coupon period is different than a year, the interest payment is annualized.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

toMaturity.description: Yield to maturity, which is the annual rate of return, assuming the instrument is held until maturity.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

spread.description: Credit spread, which is the difference in yield to maturity between a highest-quality debt instrument, also called a benchmark bond, and the debt instrument.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

macaulayDuration.description: Value range of the Macaulay duration, which is the average period (in years) of capital commitment.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

sensitivities.description: Value ranges of the price sensitivities of the debt instruments with respect to the prevailing market interest rate.

basePointValue.description: Base point value, which is the change of the debt instrument's price for a one base point change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate. One base point is equivalent to 0.01 percent (1/100 of a percent). The unit of the base point value is the value unit of the notation (see attribute `valueUnit`). Not available, if the parameter `validation.valueUnit.restrict.ids` has not been set to a single value unit.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

modifiedDuration.description: Modified duration, which is the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (nominally, not relatively) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

elasticity.description: Yield elasticity, which is the ratio of the percentage change of the debt instrument's price for a one percent change (relatively, not nominally) of the prevailing market interest rate.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

convexity.description: Convexity, which is a measure for the change of the modified duration as the prevailing market interest rate changes.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

tradedValue.description: Value ranges of the cash flow for all transactions over a given time range. The currency is the currency of denomination (see attribute `issue.volume.currency`). Not available, if the parameter `issue.volume.currency.restrict.ids` has not been set to a single currency.

days30.description: Cash flow for the time range 30 trading days.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

minimum.description: Minimum value.

maximum.description: Maximum value.

meta.description: The meta member contains the meta information of the response.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for all errors (400 ... 599 error codes)

ErrorObject.description: The errors member contains additional information about a failed request.

details.description: A human-readable, unstructured explanation specific to this occurrence of the failure.

encryptedDetails.description: Base64-encoded, internal details about the error, in addition to "details".

type.description: Internal error type of the Foundation API protocol.

attribute.description: For a validation error, a reference to the request parameter that failed validation; otherwise, an empty array.

name.description: Element of the path denoting the request parameter.

index.description: If the attribute "name" designates an array, index of the array element; otherwise the special value -1.

AttributesMember.description: Limit the attributes returned in the response to the specified set.

code.description: The HTTP status code of the response, mirroring the code from the Status-Line of the HTTP response message (see [RFC2616] section 6.1).

StatusObject.description: The status member contains the status code of the response.

CursorBasedPaginationOutputObject.description: Pagination attributes for the cursor-based pagination strategy.

total.description: Total number of entries in the result set.

isEstimatedTotal.description: Flag indicating that the value of `total` is estimated.

next.description: The next cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination, otherwise `null`.

previous.description: The previous cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination. If a previous cursor position is not supported or available, `previous` is `null`.

CursorBasedPaginationOutputObjectWithout.description: Pagination attributes for the cursor-based pagination strategy; a total element count is not supported.

next.description: The next cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination, otherwise `null`.

previous.description: The previous cursor position to use in the parameter `pagination.cursor` for an endpoint that supports cursor-based pagination. If a previous cursor position is not supported or available, `previous` is `null`.

OffsetBasedPaginationOutputObject.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy.

total.description: Total number of entries in the result set.

isEstimatedTotal.description: Flag indicating that the value of "total" is estimated.

OffsetBasedPaginationOutputObjectWithout.description: Pagination attributes for the offset-based pagination strategy; a total element count is not supported.

hasNext.description: Flag indicating that a subsequent request with the same parameters, except that the parameter `pagination.offset` is incremented by `pagination.limit`, would yield additional results.

isPartial.description: Flag indicating that the response is a possibly incomplete array or an object containing a possibly incomplete array, due to hitting a processing time limit. If `true`, some matching results might be missing from the array, or elements for matching results might be incorrectly included (for example, when priority sorting would have removed the element). Depending on the use case, such a response may be unsuitable.

PartialOutputObject.description: Object denoting that the endpoint response is possibly incomplete.
